__TOC__

UEC can be easily deployed from the <nowiki>[[UEC-CDInstall|Ubuntu Server CDs]]</nowiki>, or <nowiki>[[UEC-PackageInstall|directly from packages]]</nowiki> on an existing Ubuntu server.  This is typically sufficient if the administrator is deploying a small cloud, or only needs to deploy UEC once.

However, some UEC developers deploy UEC many times per day.  And some UEC administrators may need to deploy hundreds of systems.

This documentation describes an UEC Provisioning System, which can automate much of the UEC deployment process.

# Configure your <nowiki>[[UEC-Provisioning-DD-WRT|DD-WRT]]</nowiki> router or similar DHCP/DNSMasq server appropriately
# Configure a local Ubuntu <nowiki>[[UEC-Provisioning-Mirror|Mirror]]</nowiki>
# Configure your <nowiki>[[UEC-Provisioning-TFTP|TFTP]]</nowiki> server
# Configure <nowiki>[[UEC-Provisioning-PXE|PXE]]</nowiki> on your TFTP server
# Configure your clients to <nowiki>[[UEC-Provisioning-WakeOnLan|WakeOnLan]]</nowiki>
# Configure the <nowiki>[[UEC-Provisioning-WebUI|Web Interface]]</nowiki> to generate preseed files and trigger installations
# Use the Web Front End to provision systems
